question: Find the cost price of Amul Paneer which is sold at Rs. 300 at a loss of 25%?
The cost price of an article is Rs. 560 and Munna Bhaiya sells it at profit of 12.5%. Find the selling price?
A mobile costing Rs. 24000 is sold and a profit of 10% is received. Find selling price of mobile.
. A bicycle has a cost price of Rs. 3000 and is sold at a loss of 15%. Find the selling price.
An item is sold for Rs.240 thereby getting a profit of 20%. Find cost price of item.
A trader marks his goods 40% above the cost price and gives a discount of 20%. What is his gain or loss percentage?
An article is sold for ₹240 at a loss of 20%. For how much should it be sold to gain 20%?
If the cost price of 15 articles is equal to the selling price of 12 articles, what is the profit percentage?
A man buys a fan for ₹1200 and sells it at a loss of 15%. What is the selling price?
A shopkeeper sells two items each at ₹100—one at 25% gain and the other at 25% loss. What is the overall result?
An article is marked at ₹500. A successive discount of 10% and 20% is given. What is the final selling price?
A man sold an article at 10% profit. If he had sold it for ₹40 more, the profit would be 20%. What is the cost price?
A person incurs a loss of 10% on selling a chair for ₹540. What is the cost price?
If the selling price of an article is 5/4 of its cost price, what is the profit percentage?
By selling an article for ₹1000, a man gains 25%. What will be the selling price to gain 40%?
An iron is sold for Rs.315 and incurred a loss of 10%. Find the cost price of iron.
A shopkeeper sells items at cost price but he uses a weight of 920 gram for 1 Kg. Find his gain percent.
If in place of 1 kg weight, a weight of 800 grams is used and the goods are sold at cost price, find the profit percent.
A  dealer sells items at 20% profit and also uses a weight which is 10% less than actual, find his net profit percent.

Peter buys a brand new Honda bicycle for Rs. 800/-. He uses it for a year and then sells it. He makes a profit of 10% in this transaction. Then again he buys a new cycle but finds that the price has gone up by 20 %. He uses it for a year and then sells it for a profit of 30%. Find the average annual profit of Peter.
